Dating: 18TH DYNASTY (not before); AMENHOTEP III/AMENOPHIS III/NEBMAATRE (not after)
Name: Scarab fragment
Description: A fragment of commemorative scarab made from schist. The underside is inscribed in hieroglyphic text and the names of Amenhotep III and Queen Tiye are clearly seen within cartouches. Parts of the king's full titulary are also visible.Such scarabs were issued to record events within the king's reign, for example. to commemorate his marriage to a Mitanni princess and the construction of a 'pleasure-lake' for Tiye amongst other things, and as such they were dispatched to the further reaches of the empire.
